content:
Lion that wanted
 friendship 
 
 Joachim Muhindo
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Once upon time, a lion 
 
 wanted to come out of the 
 
 bush and have a human as 
 
 a friend. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 And so the lion and the 
 
 man became friends. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 They ate together and 
 
 shared meat. The lion 
 
 realised that the man was 
 
 a meat lover. It began to 
 
 fear that the man would kil 
 
 it. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The lion feared that 
 
 perhaps the man might 
 
 spear it with his spears. 
 
 The man feared that the 
 
 lion might eat him at night 
 
 when he slept. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One night the man 
 
 dreamed that the lion was 
 
 moving towards him 
 
 slowly, trying to eat him. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The man tok up his spear, 
 
 shouting, “If you want to 
 
 eat me, then I wil spear 
 
 you.” The lion woke up and 
 
 ran out, “I said this man wil 
 
 one day kil me.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 From that day, the lion and 
 
 the man were no longer 
 
 friends. The lion wil kil a 
 
 human whenever it finds 
 
 one. And humans wil kil a 
 
 lion if they can. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 That is why it is said: if someone wants friendship 
 
 with you, you should first know about that person’s 
 
 character. You should know if you can be together 
 
 peacefuly. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8
